definition: to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
to lose/to miss/to fail
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan

sentences.english: He was disconcerted to discover that he had lost the papers.
sentences.chinese: 他發現自己遺失文件而驚慌失措。

sentences.english: You may even be panic-stricken because she looks bored.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她似乎被悶着了，你甚至可能驚慌失措。

sentences.english: When the fire broke out in the ship, Sally was frightened out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 當輪船忽然着火時，薩莉嚇得驚慌失措。

sentences.english: His harried assistant witnesses the scene with dismay.
sentences.chinese: 被逼急的助理看到這種情形，顯得驚慌失措。

sentences.english: They hurry-scurry hitched a white flag after we warned.
sentences.chinese: 我們發出警告之後，他們便驚慌失措地扯起了白旗。

sentences.english: The interrogatory seemed to strike the honest magistrate all of a heAP.
sentences.chinese: 這場盤問似乎叫那正直的地方法官驚慌失措了。

sentences.english: By 9.35pm guests there were trapped and in panic.
sentences.chinese: 晚間9點35分，驚慌失措的顧客們被困在酒店中。

sentences.english: He panics . Ender stored the information away for future reference.
sentences.chinese: 他驚慌失措，安德先記下這點留待以後。

sentences.english: But this is the summer, we stopped panicking.
sentences.chinese: 不過，就在這個夏季，我們不再驚慌失措。

sentences.english: Thousands of panick-stricken residents slept on the streets.
sentences.chinese: 數千人驚慌失措的居人睡在大街上。
他對這次事故感到驚慌失措。

sentences.english: There is no need to panic, but there is a need for a call for action.
sentences.chinese: 沒有必要驚慌失措，但是確有必要呼籲人們行動起來。

sentences.english: The dog ran through the church and caused quite a commotion.
sentences.chinese: 那條狗在教會橫衝直撞，大家一時驚慌失措。

sentences.english: He panicked at the sight of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 他一看到觀衆就變得驚慌失措。

sentences.english: Noise in the audience flurried the actor so that he forgot his lines.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆中的吵鬧聲使這位演員驚慌失措，把臺詞給忘了。

sentences.english: Many will doubtless be thrown into panic should a disaster strike.
sentences.chinese: 如有大難臨頭，很多人會驚慌失措。

definition: to turn pale with fright (idiom)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
panic-stricken
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to keep silent
hit by a bullet/shot
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to be unable to move a single step
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
to alarm/to agitate
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
to yell/hubbub
